title: Gaza’s desperate hunger: Families struggle to fend off starvation
description: Unable to find flour, some families have resorted to eating animal feed. Many people are only eating once a day. Aid agencies warn that famine is looming.

title: French proposal for free fertility tests at age 25 outrages women’s groups
description: After French President Emmanuel Macron announced his plan to reverse the declining birth rate, one activist said to “leave our uteruses in peace.”

title: Biden to deploy CIA director to help broker major Gaza deal
description: CIA Director William Burns will urge Israel and Hamas to agree on a deal that seeks the release of all hostages in Gaza in exchange for a two-month cease-fire.

title: U.S. signals it is open to withdrawing some troops from Iraq
description: As Iraqi opposition grows to strikes on Iranian proxies, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin looks to begin conversations on ‘transition’ of U.S. force presence.

title: Russia sentences woman to 27 years in bomb assassination of  blogger
description: The blogger, known as Vladlen Tatarsky, was killed when a statuette exploded. In a separate case, Igor Girkin, a war hawk and Putin critic, was given four years for inciting extremism.

title: Kharkiv’s air defense struggles to halt nonstop Russian missiles
description: Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second-largest city, is 19 miles from the Russian border and under frequent missile attack. The time from launch to impact can be less than a minute.

title: Triumphant Hindu mobs stoke fears in India after Modi delivers temple
description: There have been reports of increased numbers of provocative marches by Hindu activists through Muslim neighborhoods in the aftermath of the new Ayodhya temple consecration.

title: Explaining immigration parole, one sticking point in Ukraine aid-border deal
description: The Biden administration’s use of “parole,” which allows migrants to enter the U.S., has been a point of conflict in negotiations for a Ukraine aid-border deal.

title: Austrian who imprisoned, raped daughter for decades to go to general prison
description: Josef Fritzl was handed a life sentence in 2009 after being convicted of incest, 3,000 instances of rape, coercion, false imprisonment, enslavement and homicide of one of the seven children he fathered with his daughter.

title: Ukraine alleges Russian disinformation in downing of military plane
description: Russia said 65 Ukrainian prisoners of war were on board and that no one survived. Ukraine said it could not confirm the deaths of POWs and called for an international investigation.

title: S. Korean lawmaker struck in head, weeks after opposition leader’s stabbing
description: The attack on Bae Hyun-jin comes three weeks after the stabbing of opposition leader Lee Jae-myung and ahead of a bitter parliamentary election set for April.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: WHO chief denounces civilian deaths in Khan Younis; initial ICJ ruling expected Friday
description: The International Court of Justice is set to rule on South Africa’s request that Israel stop its military campaign in Gaza. The genocide case will be decided later.

title: On foreign policy, Trump and Haley aren’t as different as they claim
description: The former president has called his Republican rival a “warmonger.” Meanwhile, she said he buddied up to dictators.

title: Japan sentences anime studio arsonist to death for killing 36
description: Lawyers argued that Shinji Aoba was mentally unstable when he set fire to a Kyoto animation studio, killing 36 and injuring 32, in 2019, an attack that shocked Japan.

title: Salt in tea? U.S. chemist’s recipe brews controversy in U.K.
description: The U.S. Embassy in London and the British government both weighed in.
